posts.post_content: I really can't see what it is you do not "understand" about this card. Sakura-tribe elder does put a land into play, but this one ensures you do not miss your land drop. Sakura-tribe elder needs to be sacraficed to put a land into play, making it into more of a rampant growth; this is a 2/2 creature that stays around for overrun. If you are playing green agro without caring about your land drops, then you are probably doing something wrong. Plus, this is an elf, so I don't know what more you would want... I mean even the art is dark and awesome.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: I think most of the time I'd take [Sylvan Ranger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sylvan Ranger) over this. I can tolerate smaller P/T for an easier mana curve fit. Posted By: packmaster (10/26/2011 3:44:28 AM)

posts.post_content:
i run four of these in my green deck, which is great for ensuring the 4th turn land drop, which is generally when i start on my bigger strategies.  
 i use cards like this so i can run fewer lands in my deck, and still play high cmc stuff.  
example of an actual hand i kept, despite having one land  
Forest  
[Rampant Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rampant Growth)  
[Arbor Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arbor Elf)/[LLanowar Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=LLanowar Elf)  
2 x Civic Wayfinders  
[Primeval Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primeval Titan)  
[Oracle of Mul-Daya](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oracle of Mul-Daya)  
[Dungrove Elder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dungrove Elder).  
  
turn 1, forest, elf (2 mana)  
turn 2, rampant growth (3 mana)  
turn 3, civic wayfinder, forest (4 mana)  
turn 4, civic wayfinder, forest (5 mana)  
turn 5, odds are i drew a forest, so i drop that and primeval titan (8 mana)  
turn 6, oracle, hopefully 1-2 forest from it, attack with titan (10+mana)  
this card helps with 10+ mana on turn 6. pretty good imo  
  
4/5
posts.html:
